subject: Make minimum default num_engine_workers>=4
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-18 20:00:36.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/pre_test_hook.sh', 'heat/common/config.py', 'heat/cmd/engine.py'], 'message': "Make minimum default num_engine_workers>=4

Downstream test environments are frequently having failing stacks with
error messages like:

  MessagingTimeout: resources[0]: Timed out waiting for a reply to
  message ID ...

These environments generally have 1 or 2 cores, so only spawn one or two
engine workers. This deadlocks with stacks that have many nested stacks
due to engine->engine RPC calls.

Even our own functional tests don't work reliably with less than 4
workers, and the workaround has been to set that explicitly in
pre_test_hook.sh.

This change sets the default minimum number of workers to 4, but still
matches workers to cores for larger servers.

This change also moves the default evaluation to heat.cmd.engine so that
generated configuration doesn't get a inappropriate default value.

Change-Id: Iae6b3956bad414406d901bb2213c9ec230ff4304
Closes-Bug: #1526045
(cherry picked from commit adb21217955e59fce5fb194635b36b5b40d6d8c8)
"}]
commit_message:
Make minimum default num_engine_workers>=4

Downstream test environments are frequently having failing stacks with
error messages like:

  MessagingTimeout: resources[0]: Timed out waiting for a reply to
  message ID ...

These environments generally have 1 or 2 cores, so only spawn one or two
engine workers. This deadlocks with stacks that have many nested stacks
due to engine->engine RPC calls.

Even our own functional tests don't work reliably with less than 4
workers, and the workaround has been to set that explicitly in
pre_test_hook.sh.

This change sets the default minimum number of workers to 4, but still
matches workers to cores for larger servers.

This change also moves the default evaluation to heat.cmd.engine so that
generated configuration doesn't get a inappropriate default value.

Change-Id: Iae6b3956bad414406d901bb2213c9ec230ff4304
Closes-Bug: #1526045
(cherry picked from commit adb21217955e59fce5fb194635b36b5b40d6d8c8)

subject: Make sources-branch-updater checkout the SHA properly
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-18 15:41:04.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/sources-branch-updater.sh'], 'message': "Make sources-branch-updater checkout the SHA properly

Currently the sources-branch-updater script incorrectly handles the
clone/checkout process and ends up always copying the master branch
files into whichever branch it's trying to update.

This fixes it so that it correctly checks out to the correct SHA
before copying the updated files over.

Change-Id: I684bc060bf0a4bf4398673b4ca84a2660ee6e1b9
"}]
commit_message:
Make sources-branch-updater checkout the SHA properly

Currently the sources-branch-updater script incorrectly handles the
clone/checkout process and ends up always copying the master branch
files into whichever branch it's trying to update.

This fixes it so that it correctly checks out to the correct SHA
before copying the updated files over.

Change-Id: I684bc060bf0a4bf4398673b4ca84a2660ee6e1b9

commit_message:
Re-enabling checkout and small fixes

1. Re-enabled the check-only flag for make messages. This previously did
not work because we did not have a locale file in master to revert back to.

2. Removed reduntant settings in the enabled file. The auto discovery will
take care of importing the JS files correctly.

3. Added to the documentation to include latest enabled file.

Change-Id: I8e878b60bd5951b4741171136a5e082c4007e0de

subject: Prune old branches in early devstack clone
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-18 06:27:52.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-devstack/extra-data.d/50-early-source-repo'], 'message': "Prune old branches in early devstack clone

In a rather confusing addendum to
Ieb6a6e9f55bd93f63c3d0a71828c276c2d02e1b9, we have actually mirrored a
version of the source-repo script from dib and munged it to cache
devstack early so we can use it to find the vm images to download and
cache.

However, we are not ensuring that we remove old branches in this
clone, which is leading to the problems of us picking up images from
old branches that don't exist any more.

Change-Id: I41e81d6bac98875eecde2376e0865784626e11a8
"}]
commit_message:
Prune old branches in early devstack clone

In a rather confusing addendum to
Ieb6a6e9f55bd93f63c3d0a71828c276c2d02e1b9, we have actually mirrored a
version of the source-repo script from dib and munged it to cache
devstack early so we can use it to find the vm images to download and
cache.

However, we are not ensuring that we remove old branches in this
clone, which is leading to the problems of us picking up images from
old branches that don't exist any more.

Change-Id: I41e81d6bac98875eecde2376e0865784626e11a8

subject: gate fixer: Fix devstack auth issue and new PEP8 violation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-14 23:39:49.000000000', 'files': ['akanda/rug/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/4f695b725637_initial_migration.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'gate fixer: Fix devstack auth issue and new PEP8 violation

Squashes two commits needed to unblock the gate:

devstack: prevent auth params set in env. polluting client calls

The switch to keystone v3 has introduces issues when other devstack
components set tenant or project name in environment, as it overrides
those set by us in our plugin script.  This ensures that doesnt happen.
It also updates usage of upload_image to avoid issuing a token (no longer
needed) and uses openstack client to create the nova flavor using clouds.yaml.

Fix E402 pep8 violation

Change-Id: Icfd0790e0f23bc9daaef6e006e39e3b94e42417e
(cherry picked from commit da8d8cd9fc04b4d0ac468cf4789175693a6cf3d2)
'}]
commit_message:
gate fixer: Fix devstack auth issue and new PEP8 violation

Squashes two commits needed to unblock the gate:

devstack: prevent auth params set in env. polluting client calls

The switch to keystone v3 has introduces issues when other devstack
components set tenant or project name in environment, as it overrides
those set by us in our plugin script.  This ensures that doesnt happen.
It also updates usage of upload_image to avoid issuing a token (no longer
needed) and uses openstack client to create the nova flavor using clouds.yaml.

Fix E402 pep8 violation

Change-Id: Icfd0790e0f23bc9daaef6e006e39e3b94e42417e
(cherry picked from commit da8d8cd9fc04b4d0ac468cf4789175693a6cf3d2)

commit_message:
Skip gate FS optimization if no secondary disk

This commit removes the assumption that all gate nodes have a secondary
disk, and skip tuning the filesystem if the node doesn't have one.

This fixes gate failures on OVH nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1525047

Change-Id: Ief22f34b32caf7a8b446df888fc5cc1964ad272e
(cherry picked from commit 40b8a0243e20d551f2e153759f531749783656be)

This patch fixes an issue with the V2 driver where neutron validation

Change-Id: Ic148b73c0ff1d940ac19f3aac298141344888ea7
Closes-bug: #1533803
"}]
commit_message:
Instance creation fails with the new V2 driver

This patch fixes an issue with the V2 driver where neutron validation
will fail for security groups when trying to start an instance.
This is due to the modification of the port's context that leads to an
evaluation error in Neutron's RPC notifier.

Change-Id: Ic148b73c0ff1d940ac19f3aac298141344888ea7
Closes-bug: #1533803

commit_message:
remove option verbose from config files

Option "verbose" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated for removal.
Its value may be silently ignored in the future.

If this option is not set explicitly, there is no such warning.
Furthermore, the default value of verbose is true, so there is
no need to set this value in config files.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I3ec2a8900c984a64bc0645672ef89a63975f7f4e

commit_message:
Fix validation of server personality property

During validation, the software config content will not be
available via get_attr function. Hence we will end up calling
encode on a NoneType object.

Try to encode to utf-8 only if content is available.

Change-Id: I3e7dc4a9fcbd95482df880a7454fa5a09d6af68f
Closes-Bug: #1528463
(cherry picked from commit 054f6807398eae4625c0b639837c979cdaf299e3)

commit_message:
Automatically generate etc/orchestrator.ini file

This switches keystone to use oslo-config-generator, where the contents
of our sample configuration file are configured using a configuration
file in etc/oslo-config-generator.

Also fix some config problems.

blueprint autogen-astara-conf-file

Change-Id: I394805b18eecc4fbc583f9d64d34b8e95b55a845

subject: gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional fails with 300 response code
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-19 10:40:51.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_auth.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/utils.py', 'novaclient/client.py'], 'message': "gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional fails with 300 response code

Novaclient's functional test will try to authenticate against v1.0 auth
service when auth_url didn't contain version in cloud.yaml. Keystone
will response 300 status code. Novaclient wouldn't handle such status
code yet, therefore gate will fails with 300 response code.

The requested resource will contain multiple version links. We should
select v2.0 version.

Change-Id: I2b4fba4f87e3b3ccc0ecac1587a8b307b1129770
Related-Bug: 1506103
"}]
commit_message:
gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional fails with 300 response code

Novaclient's functional test will try to authenticate against v1.0 auth
service when auth_url didn't contain version in cloud.yaml. Keystone
will response 300 status code. Novaclient wouldn't handle such status
code yet, therefore gate will fails with 300 response code.

The requested resource will contain multiple version links. We should
select v2.0 version.

Change-Id: I2b4fba4f87e3b3ccc0ecac1587a8b307b1129770
Related-Bug: 1506103

commit_message:
Cache agent clean steps on node

In order to make getting clean/zap steps a synchronous call, instead of
one that blocks on communication with the agent, the agent clean steps
should be cached to the node object. Any time cleaning is started, the
steps will be fetched from the agent and cached.

Deprecates ilo.clean_priority_erase_devices, as we can use just use
agent.agent_erase_devices_priority, instead of having two config
options that do the exact same thing.

Partial-implements blueprint: implement-zapping-states

Change-Id: I0ef5369f0a14c27ccd8bb09bf3835f86b8aba018

subject: Make minimum default num_engine_workers>=4
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-15 09:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/pre_test_hook.sh', 'heat/common/config.py', 'heat/cmd/engine.py'], 'message': "Make minimum default num_engine_workers>=4

Downstream test environments are frequently having failing stacks with
error messages like:

  MessagingTimeout: resources[0]: Timed out waiting for a reply to
  message ID ...

These environments generally have 1 or 2 cores, so only spawn one or two
engine workers. This deadlocks with stacks that have many nested stacks
due to engine->engine RPC calls.

Even our own functional tests don't work reliably with less than 4
workers, and the workaround has been to set that explicitly in
pre_test_hook.sh.

This change sets the default minimum number of workers to 4, but still
matches workers to cores for larger servers.

This change also moves the default evaluation to heat.cmd.engine so that
generated configuration doesn't get a inappropriate default value.

Change-Id: I99eb0ffec0626607ad5085a55ec4291881a1ed0e
Closes-Bug: #1526045
"}]
commit_message:
Make minimum default num_engine_workers>=4

Downstream test environments are frequently having failing stacks with
error messages like:

  MessagingTimeout: resources[0]: Timed out waiting for a reply to
  message ID ...

These environments generally have 1 or 2 cores, so only spawn one or two
engine workers. This deadlocks with stacks that have many nested stacks
due to engine->engine RPC calls.

Even our own functional tests don't work reliably with less than 4
workers, and the workaround has been to set that explicitly in
pre_test_hook.sh.

This change sets the default minimum number of workers to 4, but still
matches workers to cores for larger servers.

This change also moves the default evaluation to heat.cmd.engine so that
generated configuration doesn't get a inappropriate default value.

Change-Id: I99eb0ffec0626607ad5085a55ec4291881a1ed0e
Closes-Bug: #1526045

commit_message:
Reduced the complexity of the get_events method

The get_events method is very large - almost 140 lines
(in ceilometer/event/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py).

I extracted some of the functionalities into helper functions
to reduce the length and complexity of get_events.
Additionally it became more readable as well, without
changing its functionality.

Change-Id: I23d0dea303826a2d49e3612be765e4de64178897
Closes-Bug: #1512755

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-11 21:41:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Ignore driver pause operation during live migrate

The pause-vm-during-live_migration blueprint implements
a new nova api that allows a user to sepcify that they want
to force a live migration to finish.  This api call is
translated to the compute driver's pause operation.
PowerVM does not support pausing a VM. Since we don't want
the api or pause to fail we'll just ignore it while the VM
is migrating.  PowerVM already has logic to limit the length
of a live migration.

blueprint pause-vm-during-live-migration

Change-Id: Ib6a6d30e9cfd3f97d4e0c9ee26ea6a16062aca13
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore driver pause operation during live migrate

The pause-vm-during-live_migration blueprint implements
a new nova api that allows a user to sepcify that they want
to force a live migration to finish.  This api call is
translated to the compute driver's pause operation.
PowerVM does not support pausing a VM. Since we don't want
the api or pause to fail we'll just ignore it while the VM
is migrating.  PowerVM already has logic to limit the length
of a live migration.

blueprint pause-vm-during-live-migration

Change-Id: Ib6a6d30e9cfd3f97d4e0c9ee26ea6a16062aca13

commit_message:
Remove hard-coded DEPLOYWAIT timeout from Baremetal Scenario

Currently the baremetal scenario is hardcoded to wait 15 seconds
for the ironic node to reach the wait-callback state. This patch
uses a configuration option in place of this hardcoded value.

Closes-Bug: #1526466
Change-Id: I8cded9467dc03d9e1a75222bb4b017604ae946af

subject: Enable keystone handling of X-Forwarded-Proto header
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-14 15:18:45.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable keystone handling of X-Forwarded-Proto header

If the X-Forwarded-Proto header is received by keystone, this option
will make the service properly handle it. This is useful, for instance,

Change-Id: I31a1f51591e8423367e61eafc3af9b2d61278468
'}]
commit_message:
Enable keystone handling of X-Forwarded-Proto header

If the X-Forwarded-Proto header is received by keystone, this option
will make the service properly handle it. This is useful, for instance,
if TLS is enabled for the admin endpoint.

Change-Id: I31a1f51591e8423367e61eafc3af9b2d61278468

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.
This patch fixes this problem.
See Also: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/191600

Change-Id: Ibb86bca3d3e11197301629be15fdcedd46761dd3
Closes-bug: #1465086

Instead of starting two virtual machines for two different lint like
tests, merge all lint like tests into a single environment. The new
environment is called "linters" to make the purpose of it clearer.

We need to keep the separate pep8 and bandit environments to not break

commit_message:
Merge pep8 and bandit test environments

Instead of starting two virtual machines for two different lint like
tests, merge all lint like tests into a single environment. The new
environment is called "linters" to make the purpose of it clearer.

We need to keep the separate pep8 and bandit environments to not break
the CI jobs, those can only be removed in the future.

Needed-By: Id7820a8fe188c4de3ba94916e07fd54b7bb4e6fd
Change-Id: Ibcbe9b5c3ae413eae82f1fec0be13e7a50cb1a51

subject: Resolve MariaDB/Galera cluster startup/logging issues
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 10:54:20.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_post_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/templates/my.cnf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/handlers/main.yml'], 'message': 'Resolve MariaDB/Galera cluster startup/logging issues

This patch ensures that MariaDB is given adequate time to start on a
resources constrained system (180s versus the default of 30s),
ensures that the error log is appropriately populated and also
provides a failback restart in the case where there may be a corrupt
sst directory.

In the handler changes:
 - the environment variable "MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT" is now being
   passed into the init script because the defaults are not being
   sourced at the init script runtime.
 - the temporary "sst" directory is cleaned up should the handler
   restart fail. This ensurez that a node is in a clean state if a
   leftover sst directory was on the disk which would cause a node
   to fail to join a cluster or bootstrap.

In the task changes:
 - a new configuration file (part of the mariadb package) is being
   removed which has unforeseen options within it causing no logs
   to be created.
 - a mysql ping check is implemented to verify that the service is
   responding after the restart handler is fired.

This patch is based on:
 - https://review.openstack.org/256016
 - https://review.openstack.org/266265
 - https://review.openstack.org/268707

Closes-Bug: #1532761
Closes-Bug: #1533126
Change-Id: I16af30c660790656fc2d59f9943c172b88098905

Wait for galera to respond after restarts

Add a mysql ping check to verify the service is responding
after a restart handler is fired.

Change-Id: Idfc1e1a1113ab0ffa221e4c0a4cc074df23fe89a
(cherry picked from commit f6fb63f3477e7cdada1a1be8d670755a0e4e6f0b)
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve MariaDB/Galera cluster startup/logging issues

This patch ensures that MariaDB is given adequate time to start on a
resources constrained system (180s versus the default of 30s),
ensures that the error log is appropriately populated and also
provides a failback restart in the case where there may be a corrupt
sst directory.

In the handler changes:
 - the environment variable "MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT" is now being
   passed into the init script because the defaults are not being
   sourced at the init script runtime.
 - the temporary "sst" directory is cleaned up should the handler
   restart fail. This ensurez that a node is in a clean state if a
   leftover sst directory was on the disk which would cause a node
   to fail to join a cluster or bootstrap.

In the task changes:
 - a new configuration file (part of the mariadb package) is being
   removed which has unforeseen options within it causing no logs
   to be created.
 - a mysql ping check is implemented to verify that the service is
   responding after the restart handler is fired.

This patch is based on:
 - https://review.openstack.org/256016
 - https://review.openstack.org/266265
 - https://review.openstack.org/268707

Closes-Bug: #1532761
Closes-Bug: #1533126
Change-Id: I16af30c660790656fc2d59f9943c172b88098905

Wait for galera to respond after restarts

Add a mysql ping check to verify the service is responding
after a restart handler is fired.

Change-Id: Idfc1e1a1113ab0ffa221e4c0a4cc074df23fe89a
(cherry picked from commit f6fb63f3477e7cdada1a1be8d670755a0e4e6f0b)

commit_message:
fix project_id and user_id fields not set when create gnocchi alarm

When using command alarm-gnocchi-* the project_id and user_id are not
set. The patch fix it and add related tests:

1.ceilometer gnocchi alarm create/update test cases
2.check gnocchi alarm create/update command args test cases
3.check update alarm without alarm-id
4.check shadowed args are restored

Closes-Bug: #1506509
Change-Id: If6a8cfd9bc52b3eeff99dfcfdee2f4da7220674b

commit_message:
Skip AIDE initialization by default

The AIDE database initialization consumes a lot of CPU time and I/O resources.
We shouldn't initialize the database by default, but this should be
configurable by the deployer.

Closes-bug: 1534658

Change-Id: If680000619c35914e58ed8b7883c7eaa7928cec4

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-07 02:50:01.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then,
run py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to
avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ieb28867621ba4c3679cc32bb8288342d18f753c2

'}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then,
run py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to
avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ieb28867621ba4c3679cc32bb8288342d18f753c2
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Create packetary project

This project provides object model and API for dealing with deb
and rpm repositories. One can use this framework to
implement operations like building repository
from a set of packages, clone repository, find package
dependencies, mix repositories, pull out a subset of
packages into a separate repository, etc.

Change-Id: Ic4b285f6e8d6d0489b5c0ca6ca5eee2bdab0672f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 16:32:49.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove glance python34 jobs on Liberty

I made the python34 job voting on Glance to ensure that no Python 3
regression is introduced in master. Since Glance does not support
Python 3 in master, it is a waste of resources to run Python 3 tests
on Liberty.

The python34 jobs are already skipped on Kilo.

Removing Python 3 tests was proposed to not break gates when my
oslo.context change If48ee7f4d1c113f1f26b3b1698c6b055807b950f will be
merged into oslo.context. I proposed to update Glance tests to
support this change. The Glance patch was merged in master but
rejected in Liberty: see change
Ia8578ecab1b1f1bf21020c91290458efad646cd9. The consensus was to
remove the gate instead.

Change-Id: Ia4df8f05d5746887eb99bbf368d29e8d30a3a90a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove glance python34 jobs on Liberty

I made the python34 job voting on Glance to ensure that no Python 3
regression is introduced in master. Since Glance does not support
Python 3 in master, it is a waste of resources to run Python 3 tests
on Liberty.

The python34 jobs are already skipped on Kilo.

Removing Python 3 tests was proposed to not break gates when my
oslo.context change If48ee7f4d1c113f1f26b3b1698c6b055807b950f will be
merged into oslo.context. I proposed to update Glance tests to
support this change. The Glance patch was merged in master but
rejected in Liberty: see change
Ia8578ecab1b1f1bf21020c91290458efad646cd9. The consensus was to
remove the gate instead.

Change-Id: Ia4df8f05d5746887eb99bbf368d29e8d30a3a90a

commit_message:
Delete heat stack on app delete

This patch addresses the deletion of heat stack on solum
app delete. Prior to this patch, on issuing an app delete
command solum would only remove the app entries from solum
registry.

Closes-Bug: #1517588

commit_message:
Remove translation from repos that are not setup

This for horizon-cisco-ui, ironic-ui, trove-dashboard, zaqar-ui.

These four repositories are not setup yet for translations, the periodic (daily)
jobs fail for them and there's no effort going on to fix them.

Disable translations. Once repositories are setup we can readd.

subject: Avoid git clone in integration test
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-15 20:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['integration-test/test.sh'], 'message': 'Avoid git clone in integration test

Allow script to be called with a third argument which is a path to a
checked out directory. This allows setting up the repo externally using
zuul-cloner in the infra script and allows usage of depends-on.

Simplify the script a bit, we can remove the special handling for file
and also do not need to give a default argument, this is called from
tox.

Change-Id: I3b6180b6b274966de63fe281021ff9f4186a929b
Needed-By: I828c1875e5f008fa55b693ad210421794395f623
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid git clone in integration test

Allow script to be called with a third argument which is a path to a
checked out directory. This allows setting up the repo externally using
zuul-cloner in the infra script and allows usage of depends-on.

Simplify the script a bit, we can remove the special handling for file
and also do not need to give a default argument, this is called from
tox.

Change-Id: I3b6180b6b274966de63fe281021ff9f4186a929b
Needed-By: I828c1875e5f008fa55b693ad210421794395f623

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra
for our CI, we should drop py33 support too.

Change-Id: I453abf7ed4ff7ed0996bfb1578e68a791c3b40a5
Closes-Bug: #1526170
'}]
commit_message:
Drop py33 support

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra
for our CI, we should drop py33 support too.

Change-Id: I453abf7ed4ff7ed0996bfb1578e68a791c3b40a5
Closes-Bug: #1526170

subject: Replace assertTrue(isinstance()) with assertIsInstance()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-11 07:20:36.000000000', 'files': ['solumclient/tests/common/test_exc.py'], 'message': 'Replace assertTrue(isinstance()) with assertIsInstance()

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.
Closes-Bug: #1268480

Change-Id: I0a318979a926b630e534fe6c76d9188640cf7ce0
'}]
commit_message:
Replace assertTrue(isinstance()) with assertIsInstance()

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.
Closes-Bug: #1268480

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-18 16:57:05.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'disable voting for tempest-dsvm-keystone-eventlet-full

This job has been failing too often lately, each time with a timeout
related failures.

For example: http://logs.openstack.org/68/264068/6/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-keystone-eventlet-full/947b46b/console.html#_2016-01-17_21_42_48_600

Jobs that are passing are taking around 1h 44m, but the ones that
fail seem to be around 1h 58m.

This is impacting keystone development as approved code is
failing gate and check.

Temporarily disable voting of this job until we can identity
the cause of the slowdown and ensure it passes consistently.

Change-Id: I3f0d3718a62d7ebf093c4da80d983692b96b7dfe
'}]
commit_message:
disable voting for tempest-dsvm-keystone-eventlet-full

This job has been failing too often lately, each time with a timeout
related failures.

For example: http://logs.openstack.org/68/264068/6/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-keystone-eventlet-full/947b46b/console.html#_2016-01-17_21_42_48_600

Jobs that are passing are taking around 1h 44m, but the ones that
fail seem to be around 1h 58m.

This is impacting keystone development as approved code is
failing gate and check.

Temporarily disable voting of this job until we can identity
the cause of the slowdown and ensure it passes consistently.

Change-Id: I3f0d3718a62d7ebf093c4da80d983692b96b7dfe

commit_message:
Default values for enabling services in ceilometer

The os_ceilometer role makes use of variables for each OpenStack service
to configure notification queue listeners. Include default values
for those variables in the role's default vars.

Closes-Bug: #1533801

This change updates the heat modular task to only attempt to install the
heat docker packages when using a package set that provides a standalone
package. Currently only the RedHat and Debian based package sets provide

commit_message:
Skip docker resource install with UCA packages

This change updates the heat modular task to only attempt to install the
heat docker packages when using a package set that provides a standalone
package. Currently only the RedHat and Debian based package sets provide
a seperate package. The UCA packages do not provide the heat docker
templates as a separate package.

Change-Id: If66f928f8afdebd3eedad1da9ac9e5c1e23c2101
Related-Blueprint: deploy-with-uca-packages

commit_message:
Removed use of deprecated LOG.warn method

LOG.warn is deprecated. We were still used it some places.
So I replaced the LOG.warn method to LOG.warning, which is not
deprecated.

Change-Id: I9461cec569445ad6c40db9ce2feeeba1ef0af0e3
Closes-Bug: #1508442

than memcache_pool.

commit_message:
Add python-brick-cinderclient-ext project to Cinder

The python-brick-cinderclient-ext project has been created as an
extension to python-cinderclient for performing local storage
management operations independent of Nova. This patch adds the
new project to the list of Cinder projects.

Change-Id: Ibcc4c5da26aaeee99898a7c5c5e5ef1be6517029

subject: Optimize core list retrieval in reviewers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-17 18:57:21.000000000', 'files': ['reviewstats/cmd/reviewers.py'], 'message': "Optimize core list retrieval in reviewers

The list of core team members was being retrieved for every review
for each patchset. The utils.get_core_team does some caching to make
sure an API call wasn't made for each of these calls, but since the
project never changes for the review we can save a few cycles by not
making the call if it's not necessary.

This moves the retrieval of the core list before the loop through
reviews to make sure it's only called once per patchset.

Change-Id: Iac9f3b6eb71131eccce58a60656865eeb77b8fda
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize core list retrieval in reviewers

The list of core team members was being retrieved for every review
for each patchset. The utils.get_core_team does some caching to make
sure an API call wasn't made for each of these calls, but since the
project never changes for the review we can save a few cycles by not
making the call if it's not necessary.

This moves the retrieval of the core list before the loop through
reviews to make sure it's only called once per patchset.

Change-Id: Iac9f3b6eb71131eccce58a60656865eeb77b8fda

revisions:

Manually setting the content type for storing a secret has already

commit_message:
Blueprint deprecating setting secret content type in client

Manually setting the content type for storing a secret has already
been marked as deprecated. However, it is still possible to utilize
the feature. This blueprint proposes full deprecation of the feature
and refactoring the tests in the barbican client.

Change-Id: I3695b9b58839b2fb838afe0fee7659913eb59e04

commit_message:
Support Unicode request_id on Python 3

The oslo.context change If48ee7f4d1c113f1f26b3b1698c6b055807b950f
will change request_id type on Python 3 from bytes to str. This
change prepares Glance for this change.

Related-Bug: #1526662
Change-Id: Ia8578ecab1b1f1bf21020c91290458efad646cd9
(cherry picked from commit 1e316332889bcb46ce52b70603c1028f7614c2a0)

subject: Adds security_group_updated method in HyperVSecurityGroupDriver
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-10 09:26:04.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/security_groups_driver.py'], 'message': 'Adds security_group_updated method in HyperVSecurityGroupDriver

With the changes introduced in securitygroups_rpc with the
below commit hyperv code breaks.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147713/

Because of this, any changes in the security groups are not applied
by the HyperVSecurityGroupDriver because of a NotImplemented error.

Adds the security_group_updated method as noop in
HyperVSecurityGroupDriver, solving the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1512278

Change-Id: Ia5d6fca3c3a2f827ade850bb43fc7e434e934a22
'}]
commit_message:
Adds security_group_updated method in HyperVSecurityGroupDriver

With the changes introduced in securitygroups_rpc with the
below commit hyperv code breaks.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147713/

Because of this, any changes in the security groups are not applied
by the HyperVSecurityGroupDriver because of a NotImplemented error.

Adds the security_group_updated method as noop in
HyperVSecurityGroupDriver, solving the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1512278

Change-Id: Ia5d6fca3c3a2f827ade850bb43fc7e434e934a22

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-06 14:26:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'releasenotes/notes/libvirt-live-migration-new-extra-flags-option-23fac9934ba8fee2.yaml', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: add live_migration_extra_flags config option

Add a config option which will allow users to enable new, experimental,
or optional migration flags without interfering with flags that should
be wholly controlled by the logic of the driver itself.

The flags which we consider under the driver's full control are:

  * LIVE - we don't allow disabling this, but we could add a config
    option for it if there was a known use case.

  * PEER2PEER, UNDEFINE_SOURCE, PERSIST_DEST - the driver is coded
    under specific assumptions about how these flags are used.

  * TUNNELLED - we now have a config option for tweaking this.

  * NON_SHARED_INC, NON_SHARED_DISK - these are mutually exclusive; we
    use the former and don't have a use case for the latter.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib8451241cc7674394939772bda442d7fc7097343
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: add live_migration_extra_flags config option

Add a config option which will allow users to enable new, experimental,
or optional migration flags without interfering with flags that should
be wholly controlled by the logic of the driver itself.

The flags which we consider under the driver's full control are:

  * LIVE - we don't allow disabling this, but we could add a config
    option for it if there was a known use case.

  * PEER2PEER, UNDEFINE_SOURCE, PERSIST_DEST - the driver is coded
    under specific assumptions about how these flags are used.

  * TUNNELLED - we now have a config option for tweaking this.

  * NON_SHARED_INC, NON_SHARED_DISK - these are mutually exclusive; we
    use the former and don't have a use case for the latter.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib8451241cc7674394939772bda442d7fc7097343
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix rgw_keystone_url for ceph-osd

When ceph-osd is installed on same node as radosgw, it reconfigures
rgw_keystone_url to public_ip:35357. Keystone doesn't listen on
public_ip:admin_port socket.

Closes-Bug: #1533578

Change-Id: I209d101f8ebf0a31119158fb6f37382ce8c6b4fe

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-15 19:47:33.000000000', 'files': ['release_from_yaml.sh', 'release.sh'], 'message': 'remove use of virtualenv from release scripts

No longer rely on the release scripts to have a virtualenv or to set one
up. All of the tools will be installed globally, and libraries from
system packages, when we move to running these scripts on the secure
nodes in the CI system.

Change-Id: I30d430de9a690878950a8f8775b33ca7ba2896be
'}]
commit_message:
remove use of virtualenv from release scripts

No longer rely on the release scripts to have a virtualenv or to set one
up. All of the tools will be installed globally, and libraries from
system packages, when we move to running these scripts on the secure
nodes in the CI system.

Change-Id: I30d430de9a690878950a8f8775b33ca7ba2896be

commit_message:
Adding cross-project spec team

As discussed in previous cross-project meetings, we need people that can
watch for comment and/or bring in knowledge from their respected teams
when a cross-project spec is being discussed. Otherwise we end up with
teams not knowing about multi-project wide specs.

Change-Id: I1dc1f553a6fcbea5db4c44f208d825fbee934bbe

commit_message:
Supported resources list cli support

Currently there is no other way of getting list of supported
resource type than looking directly in the source codes.

This change set implements the CLI command 'resource list-types'
to list the resource type Gnocchi supports.

Change-Id: Id22209d8c515c2a97f8abf77380c656e2a52e088
Co-Authored-By: xialinjuan(ljxiash@cn.ibm.com)
Closes-bug: 1510024

commit_message:
pick a different previous version if the current version exists

If the version being released exists, look at the prior version so when
we produce the release notes and bug list we get the right commits.

Change-Id: Ifa5584e619978dbc8727284c5e88c0d72b118969

subject: default to sending mail directly via lists.openstack.org
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-14 16:30:58.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/cmds/mail.py'], 'message': 'default to sending mail directly via lists.openstack.org

When the announce script runs on a CI node, we need to ensure the email
is sent before letting the job finish and destroying the node. Rather
than using an MTA on localhost, connect directly to lists.openstack.org
and push the mail there. That will block until the email is sent, at
which point it is safe for the job to exit.

Change-Id: I60be241402d6cc42f4219edec846a3c085019058
'}]
commit_message:
default to sending mail directly via lists.openstack.org

When the announce script runs on a CI node, we need to ensure the email
is sent before letting the job finish and destroying the node. Rather
than using an MTA on localhost, connect directly to lists.openstack.org
and push the mail there. That will block until the email is sent, at
which point it is safe for the job to exit.

Change-Id: I60be241402d6cc42f4219edec846a3c085019058

commit_message:
refactor script for commenting on launchpad bugs prior to move to project-config

When we move the release tagging scripts to the project-config
repository, they will need to have minimal dependencies and shouldn't
need to import other local modules. Move the launchpad code needed by
launchpad_add_comment.py into the file, and move the file out of the
cmds subdirectory to be a regular script instead.

Change-Id: Ie004c2a14100611d4b7c1604dcf7f465a6f0246c

commit_message:
refactor list_deliverable_changes.py prior to move to project-config

When we move the release tagging scripts to the project-config
repository, they will need to have minimal dependencies and shouldn't
need to import other local modules. Move the gitutils code needed by
list_deliverable_changes.py into the file, and move the file out of the
cmds subdirectory to be a regular script instead.

Change-Id: I7076d45be04366b95b3d662ffc181373339ad6c6

commit_message:
SSL/Nova: enable ssl_header_handler filter

Enable oslo_middleware.http_proxy_to_wsgi:HTTPProxyToWSGI.factory in
ssl_header_handler middlewarefilter so we can run Nova API with SSL
support.

Change-Id: Iff914afe718bd0914d639337299589068c6dd237

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-14 00:35:26.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/test_ipmitool.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ipmitool.py'], 'message': 'Fix a bug error by passwords only includes numbers

When an IPMI password consists only of numbers, Ironic fails to create a
password file. From the format point of view, these passwords are
correct. These are that it is stored to the variable after being
converted to an int type, cause errors in the subsequent processing to
expect that it is a string type.

Change-Id: I85ee2e904fdb0d538f69c7dbfab4c81bb080b8cf
Closes-Bug: #1489234
(cherry picked from commit 93f99381acd727f539d3a78c0ae82b95860ba649)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a bug error by passwords only includes numbers

When an IPMI password consists only of numbers, Ironic fails to create a
password file. From the format point of view, these passwords are
correct. These are that it is stored to the variable after being
converted to an int type, cause errors in the subsequent processing to
expect that it is a string type.

Change-Id: I85ee2e904fdb0d538f69c7dbfab4c81bb080b8cf
Closes-Bug: #1489234
(cherry picked from commit 93f99381acd727f539d3a78c0ae82b95860ba649)

commit_message:
Map KSA exception to SDK exceptions

The use of KSA is an implementation detail. Users should not have to
know about KSA. Catch all KSA exceptions and map them to SDK
exceptions.

Change-Id: Ib873c038358fb318ae46e8bc5bd3b4dfb683daaa
Closes-Bug: #1526516

commit_message:
Adding devstack plugin for freezer gate job

Currently the plugin is moslty a copy of the
freeer-api plugin. At first instance we can enable
the gate and have the job executign without error,
after this we can commit new changes to execute
freezer specific tests. Anyway the freezer-api plugin
is most likley needed to execute the freezer-agent and
freezer-scheduler tests

Implements bp: freezer-dsvm
Depends-on: I837e3fe973d72c792cb34711cef9f6507a004d49

Fix for vCenter OSTF with Neutron

Since in Fuel 8.0 nova-network was removed. Currently vCenter env
requires DVS or NSXv plugin as networking backend.

commit_message:
puppet: allow config of ad-hoc Keystone settings

Including ::keystone::config on the controller roles will allow
ad-hoc (non-puppet managed) settings to be made in the
keystone config file using Hiera.

Change-Id: Ib711f6baf22c63c234ac058d7da504ace9ebc628

commit_message:
Replace findall with search in uuid parsing function

Fuel-bootstrap list label could contain uuid which we do not need,
so taking only first matching part.

Change-Id: Ic378f6d93362a7596fc211bcb9e3aab4678e2236
Closes-Bug: #1533571
(cherry picked from commit f4717fa6d5f29676ce80e70b8c36383399b38f3b)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-17 15:16:39.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': 'Implement a callback plugin for human readable ansible logs

This implements a callback plugin to make the ansible logs easier
to read. This is especially pertinent for the output of tasks
like shell commands and apt package actions.

It also disables the use of the verbose parameter for Ansible, as
this plugin outputs stdout/stderr anyway.

Change-Id: I56886ba1d7f99b861f625c68078583e82dae2988
(cherry picked from commit 775d256a4e6b163c78a838b7b95e9d3f3a8b5f61)
'}]
commit_message:
Implement a callback plugin for human readable ansible logs

This implements a callback plugin to make the ansible logs easier
to read. This is especially pertinent for the output of tasks
like shell commands and apt package actions.

It also disables the use of the verbose parameter for Ansible, as
this plugin outputs stdout/stderr anyway.

Change-Id: I56886ba1d7f99b861f625c68078583e82dae2988
(cherry picked from commit 775d256a4e6b163c78a838b7b95e9d3f3a8b5f61)

commit_message:
Move Neutron Types drivers under ML2 section

On wizard tab we have two neutron types drivers: VLAN and VXLAN (tun).
From UX side it's more logically to have it in ML2 core plugin section.
VXLAN is incompatible option for vmware.

Change-Id: I211c847c6fdd43d6706c905850b1097fdf332af8
Closes-Bug: #1526754

commit_message:
Default values for enabling services in ceilometer

The os_ceilometer role makes use of variables for each OpenStack service
to configure notification queue listeners. Include default values
for those variables in the role's default vars.

Change-Id: If30b5050f923e1cd0dbb004aaf7722c54b6de5d9
Closes-Bug: #1533801

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-01-17 15:11:23.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-docs/quickstart-aio.rst', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install-apt.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_loopback_nova.yml', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/main.yml', 'tests/bootstrap-aio.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_loopback_cinder.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_mongodb_users.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_ssh_keys.yml', 'doc/source/developer-docs/extending.rst', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_loopback_swap.yml', 'scripts/run-playbooks.sh', 'scripts/os-detection.py', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/vars/ubuntu.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml', 'scripts/run-aio-build.sh', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_loopback_swift.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_networking.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.aio', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tests/ansible.cfg', 'scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/check-requirements.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_data_disk.yml', 'scripts/scripts-library.sh', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_libvirt_service.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/osa_interfaces.cfg.j2', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_mongodb_service.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/apt-sources.list.j2'], 'message': 'Convert AIO bootstrap from bash to Ansible

This patch converts the AIO bootstrap process to use Ansible
instead of bash scripting. The patch also minimises the options
available to focus the role concerned to just handle an AIO
bootstrap, but gives it just enough flexibility to allow the
use of an external MongoDB database for Ceilometer/Aodh and
for a deployer to specify a secondary disk for the AIO to
consume.

A major change is that the AIO bootstrap process no longer
assumes that it can destroy a secondary boot device. It
requires a device name to be provided. This prevents horrible
surprises.

Backport Note:
While this backport respects the differences between the Master
branch and the Kilo branch, it also brings all the gating and
AIO related scripts into line with each other to ensure that all
methods and settings (where applicable) are the same.

The following differences from the Master patch are noted:
 - neutron_rpc_workers must be 0 for Kilo
 - nova_virt_type must be specifically configured for Kilo
 - the in-tree pip_install role is used (configured in
   tests/ansible.cfg) instead of the new independent role
 - All references to Aodh have been removed
 - The haproxy env.d related config task has been removed as
   this does not apply to Kilo
 - Change I98bcb478e99e11956618b2327399e18471aab534 is included
   (Add reliable OS detection for ansible bootstrap)
 - Change I31f63a2998080c6fedab3af7c2b1bb1a987d8c08 is included
   (Use pure variable name in $(()) statement)
 - Change If3a914650749d72c2eb13b9f1307ef7b4319bd2f is included
   (Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script)
 - Change Iec03c768a9fadf82831af4b90db1907abd399966 is included
   (use fastest mirror available in OpenStack-CI)
 - Change I666f53e01066bf8bff4d28fa012eadae7c958116 is included
   (Bootstrap Host with updated CPU Map for OpenStack-CI)
 - Change Ic20ab65dc68a6f82eb5bf0751a968aa662b29eb5 is included
   (Make instance info output to stdout on failure)
 - Change I28af8a587bde629fd0c81a6c4ba47dd64c2e44db is included
   (Use Ansible AIO playbook for run-aio-build.sh)
 - Change I730c838a67ca03413fbdfa43ef7606d8cf2f9cd0 is included
   (Updating AIO docs for Ansible playbook)

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh
>------scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
>------scripts/scripts-library.sh

Closes-Bug: #1522957
Implements: blueprint convert-aio-bootstrap-to-ansible
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: I6028952e7260388873f57db47cc3e08126ecc530
(cherry picked from commit 892c7fe46c68bc36e76f21a6b699349167534f46)
'}]
commit_message:
Convert AIO bootstrap from bash to Ansible

This patch converts the AIO bootstrap process to use Ansible
instead of bash scripting. The patch also minimises the options
available to focus the role concerned to just handle an AIO
bootstrap, but gives it just enough flexibility to allow the
use of an external MongoDB database for Ceilometer/Aodh and
for a deployer to specify a secondary disk for the AIO to
consume.

A major change is that the AIO bootstrap process no longer
assumes that it can destroy a secondary boot device. It
requires a device name to be provided. This prevents horrible
surprises.

Backport Note:
While this backport respects the differences between the Master
branch and the Kilo branch, it also brings all the gating and
AIO related scripts into line with each other to ensure that all
methods and settings (where applicable) are the same.

The following differences from the Master patch are noted:
 - neutron_rpc_workers must be 0 for Kilo
 - nova_virt_type must be specifically configured for Kilo
 - the in-tree pip_install role is used (configured in
   tests/ansible.cfg) instead of the new independent role
 - All references to Aodh have been removed
 - The haproxy env.d related config task has been removed as
   this does not apply to Kilo
 - Change I98bcb478e99e11956618b2327399e18471aab534 is included
   (Add reliable OS detection for ansible bootstrap)
 - Change I31f63a2998080c6fedab3af7c2b1bb1a987d8c08 is included
   (Use pure variable name in $(()) statement)
 - Change If3a914650749d72c2eb13b9f1307ef7b4319bd2f is included
   (Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script)
 - Change Iec03c768a9fadf82831af4b90db1907abd399966 is included
   (use fastest mirror available in OpenStack-CI)
 - Change I666f53e01066bf8bff4d28fa012eadae7c958116 is included
   (Bootstrap Host with updated CPU Map for OpenStack-CI)
 - Change Ic20ab65dc68a6f82eb5bf0751a968aa662b29eb5 is included
   (Make instance info output to stdout on failure)
 - Change I28af8a587bde629fd0c81a6c4ba47dd64c2e44db is included
   (Use Ansible AIO playbook for run-aio-build.sh)
 - Change I730c838a67ca03413fbdfa43ef7606d8cf2f9cd0 is included
   (Updating AIO docs for Ansible playbook)

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh
>------scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
>------scripts/scripts-library.sh

Closes-Bug: #1522957
Implements: blueprint convert-aio-bootstrap-to-ansible
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: I6028952e7260388873f57db47cc3e08126ecc530
(cherry picked from commit 892c7fe46c68bc36e76f21a6b699349167534f46)

[arch-design-draft] Reorganise operators requirements chapter

commit_message:
enable uefi boot

This patch enables uefi boot with the libvirt driver. This feature
is without some kind of functional testing and therefore
considered experimental.

Co-Authored-By: XinXiaohui <xiaohui.xin@intel.com>

Change-Id: I9d8b2896e4bd29f67ebab6ce1bc927aae271c3e7
Implements: blueprint boot-from-uefi

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-04 21:59:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/opts.py', 'nova/conf/scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Single point of entry for sample config generation

To create a "nova.conf.sample" file, we use "tox -e genconfig". This
command triggers the generator from "oslo.config" which needs entry
points in "setup.cfg". Right now we have multiple entry points to
"opts.py" files which are going to be consolidated to one single point
of entry "nova/conf/opts.py". Until all config options are moved to that
central place, we would often face merge conflicts when multiple
contributors commit patches to that one "opts.py".

To prevent that, and to make it easier for future config option moduls
in "nova/conf/", the new "nova/conf/opts.py" module collects the config
options in a dynamic way.

This is copied from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/260015/, but with
the older 2-tuple format of ("option list", [options]) replaced with a
dictionary with the option list name as the key. This is a much cleaner
way of representing the data, and less prone to errors, especially with
scripts that return options for multiple option lists.

Blueprint centralize-config-options

Change-Id: Ib43d3465c13b6813362a27d143822f18898893dc
'}]
commit_message:
Single point of entry for sample config generation

To create a "nova.conf.sample" file, we use "tox -e genconfig". This
command triggers the generator from "oslo.config" which needs entry
points in "setup.cfg". Right now we have multiple entry points to
"opts.py" files which are going to be consolidated to one single point
of entry "nova/conf/opts.py". Until all config options are moved to that
central place, we would often face merge conflicts when multiple
contributors commit patches to that one "opts.py".

To prevent that, and to make it easier for future config option moduls
in "nova/conf/", the new "nova/conf/opts.py" module collects the config
options in a dynamic way.

This is copied from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/260015/, but with
the older 2-tuple format of ("option list", [options]) replaced with a
dictionary with the option list name as the key. This is a much cleaner
way of representing the data, and less prone to errors, especially with
scripts that return options for multiple option lists.

Blueprint centralize-config-options

Change-Id: Ib43d3465c13b6813362a27d143822f18898893dc

subject: Python3: Keep compatibility for urllib.urlencode
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-17 23:56:25.000000000', 'files': ['murano/tests/unit/api/base.py'], 'message': 'Python3: Keep compatibility for urllib.urlencode

In Python3, urlencode is not ins urllib module as it used to be in Python2.7.
To keep compatibility, use urllib.parse.urlencode instead of urllib.urlencode.

Targets blueprint: murano-python-3-support

Change-Id: I6c04049636bd1e853b87cd6913ac6adf002aa76f
'}]
commit_message:
Python3: Keep compatibility for urllib.urlencode

In Python3, urlencode is not ins urllib module as it used to be in Python2.7.
To keep compatibility, use urllib.parse.urlencode instead of urllib.urlencode.

Targets blueprint: murano-python-3-support

Change-Id: I6c04049636bd1e853b87cd6913ac6adf002aa76f

commit_message:
Replace upload_core_repos with Puppet-only task

Currently the code responsible for configuring repositories on the
managed nodes is kept directly it Nailgun. This commit introduces a new
task setup_repositories that replaces upload_core_repos.

Closes-Bug: 1508486
Closes-Bug: 1533682

Change-Id: I1b83e3bfaebecdb8455d5697e320f24fb4941536

commit_message:
Add loopback ip into direct repo addresses array

Some of repositories are located on master node by default. All external
repositories will be accessible through proxy instead of local repositories
in case fuel master is isolated.

Change-Id: Ia62d7ea5567e76584f962d5bd17b1378b2688fe1
Closes-bug: #1533227

commit_message:
Puppet4 propper support in the cobbler module

* Adapt to Puppet 4
* Code cleanup

This module contains some code which should be removed because
not used after switching to IBP, but this needs deeper investigation.
This commit intended only to fix errors and warnings during
syntax checks.

Change-Id: I43fe9d2ccc0f30f8c9883161bc1454f6f23e3316
Closes-Bug: #1533354

commit_message:
Properly handle bonds with associated bridges and VLAN-tagged interfaces

When a bond has a bridge associated with it and other VLAN-tagged interfaces on
different bridges then it is neccesary to retrieve informtion about the bond
by bridge name rather than by bond name.

Change-Id: Ife0e085c7be212798139a777691528579939eb82
Closes-bug: #1532810

subject: Removed double stopping of service on SIGHUP
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-05 11:14:35.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_service/service.py'], 'message': 'Removed double stopping of service on SIGHUP

If ServiceLauncher is used for running service, during restart
of service it is stopped twice.
This is not the natural course of events when we call:
service.start()
service.stop()
service.stop()
Some kind of service fails because of such sequence of calls.

Closes-Bug: #1526734
Change-Id: Ie3897a8dd031834ee993ef857aaee290410a470f
'}]
commit_message:
Removed double stopping of service on SIGHUP

If ServiceLauncher is used for running service, during restart
of service it is stopped twice.
This is not the natural course of events when we call:
service.start()
service.stop()
service.stop()
Some kind of service fails because of such sequence of calls.

Closes-Bug: #1526734
Change-Id: Ie3897a8dd031834ee993ef857aaee290410a470f

subject: Revert "Add limited tempest job to swift3 check pipeline"
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-22 09:17:20.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/swift3.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Add limited tempest job to swift3 check pipeline"

Because ec2/s3 tests was removed from tempest [1] and ec2 engine
was switched off from nova [2] then these job should be reworked to something.
But right now there is no alternative so I supposed
just remove this job from swift3 gating.
and swift3 gating has own functional tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/222737/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/232580/

This reverts commit 45cf64f8c15ddfe73e5be81024ff0527bcc61ccc.

Change-Id: Ie04e8291d97bf5ac119ecbc8e2ecc5633d9ebc8d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add limited tempest job to swift3 check pipeline"

Because ec2/s3 tests was removed from tempest [1] and ec2 engine
was switched off from nova [2] then these job should be reworked to something.
But right now there is no alternative so I supposed
just remove this job from swift3 gating.
and swift3 gating has own functional tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/222737/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/232580/

This reverts commit 45cf64f8c15ddfe73e5be81024ff0527bcc61ccc.

Change-Id: Ie04e8291d97bf5ac119ecbc8e2ecc5633d9ebc8d

commit_message:
Delete unnecessary /generated/ from .gitignore

Previously "/generated/" is the folder in cli-reference. At present
as cli-reference is migrated to rst and no more using folder "/generated"
So we can remove this from .gitignore

commit_message:
Change URL for keystone backend check

Set httpchk option to check /v3 URL in order
to avoid getting false-positives from apache2
in case when apache is listening but keystone
is not yet configured.

Change-Id: If78e7664c0184ff1064d80bd523c44156c005d69
Closes-bug: #1533588

commit_message:
Do not show duplicate or useless dump logs

Another changes:

- fix unexpected behavior: Astute has sent huge message instead
  of string with dump file path;
- add ability to not log mcollective result;
- remove logging duplication of incoming Astute tasks.

Change-Id: Idccf9bd3e57b4c160f077df779f386f656830d38
Closes-Bug: #1534206

subject: Resolve MariaDB/Galera cluster startup/logging issues
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-01-14 17:26:18.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_post_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/templates/my.cnf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/handlers/main.yml'], 'message': 'Resolve MariaDB/Galera cluster startup/logging issues

This patch ensures that MariaDB is given adequate time to start on a
resources constrained system (180s versus the default of 30s),
ensures that the error log is appropriately populated and also
provides a failback restart in the case where there may be a corrupt
sst directory.

In the handler changes:
 - the environment variable "MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT" is now being
   passed into the init script because the defaults are not being
   sourced at the init script runtime.
 - the temporary "sst" directory is cleaned up should the handler
   restart fail. This ensurez that a node is in a clean state if a
   leftover sst directory was on the disk which would cause a node
   to fail to join a cluster or bootstrap.

In the task changes a new configuration file, that is part of the
mariadb package, is being removed which has unforeseen options
within it causing no logs to be created.

This patch is based on:
 - https://review.openstack.org/256016
 - https://review.openstack.org/266265

Closes-Bug: #1532761
Closes-Bug: #1533126
Change-Id: I16af30c660790656fc2d59f9943c172b88098905
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve MariaDB/Galera cluster startup/logging issues

This patch ensures that MariaDB is given adequate time to start on a
resources constrained system (180s versus the default of 30s),
ensures that the error log is appropriately populated and also
provides a failback restart in the case where there may be a corrupt
sst directory.

In the handler changes:
 - the environment variable "MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT" is now being
   passed into the init script because the defaults are not being
   sourced at the init script runtime.
 - the temporary "sst" directory is cleaned up should the handler
   restart fail. This ensurez that a node is in a clean state if a
   leftover sst directory was on the disk which would cause a node
   to fail to join a cluster or bootstrap.

In the task changes a new configuration file, that is part of the
mariadb package, is being removed which has unforeseen options
within it causing no logs to be created.

This patch is based on:
 - https://review.openstack.org/256016
 - https://review.openstack.org/266265

Closes-Bug: #1532761
Closes-Bug: #1533126
Change-Id: I16af30c660790656fc2d59f9943c172b88098905

subject: Append crypto-meta to user-meta
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 12279, 'name': 'Janie Richling', 'email': 'jrichli@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jrichli'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16964, 'name': 'Jonathan Hinson', 'email': 'jlhinson@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jlhinson'}, {'_account_id': 17156, 'name': 'Hamdi Roumani', 'email': 'roumani@ca.ibm.com', 'username': 'hroumani'}, {'_account_id': 18820, 'name': 'Peter Chng', 'email': 'pchng@ca.ibm.com', 'username': 'pchng'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-17 15:06:57.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_decrypter.py', 'swift/common/middleware/encrypter.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_encrypter.py', 'swift/common/middleware/decrypter.py'], 'message': 'Append crypto-meta to user-meta

Previously, the crypto-meta (IV, cipher spec) was stored in a
separate sysmeta header. However, with object_post_as_copy = false,
doing a POST to add or update user-meta resulted in the sysmeta
storing the crypto-meta not being persisted. This caused additional
functest failures, as the user-meta could not be properly decrypted.

This was likely due to storage lifecycle differences between
sysmeta and user-meta.

This patch changes crypto-meta for user-meta so that it is appended
to the user-meta value, similar to what is done for Content-Type.

After this, the {unit, func, probe} tests have the same number of
errors/failures with object_post_as_copy = false vs.
object_post_as_copy = true.

For more information, see the following Trello card:
https://trello.com/c/018BLfj1/58-fix-errors-when-using-fast-post

Change-Id: I90c4dacea59437dc0bb9b2d8c516ed50244577b0
'}]
commit_message:
Append crypto-meta to user-meta

Previously, the crypto-meta (IV, cipher spec) was stored in a
separate sysmeta header. However, with object_post_as_copy = false,
doing a POST to add or update user-meta resulted in the sysmeta
storing the crypto-meta not being persisted. This caused additional
functest failures, as the user-meta could not be properly decrypted.

This was likely due to storage lifecycle differences between
sysmeta and user-meta.

This patch changes crypto-meta for user-meta so that it is appended
to the user-meta value, similar to what is done for Content-Type.

After this, the {unit, func, probe} tests have the same number of
errors/failures with object_post_as_copy = false vs.
object_post_as_copy = true.

For more information, see the following Trello card:
https://trello.com/c/018BLfj1/58-fix-errors-when-using-fast-post

Change-Id: I90c4dacea59437dc0bb9b2d8c516ed50244577b0

commit_message:
Move the PKI initialization into post-config

To be able to use the .ssh/config file in the --root argument
the PKI initialization is moved from keystone.initialize()
(where it is deprecated anyway) into overcloud_deploy.

Change-Id: I3df5f3d43ab101bdfcbc4c32851f0217e2ae9685
Bug-ID: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1252255

commit_message:
Correctly parse csv even with extra output.

This patch ensure that the csv output is cleaned up from extra warning
message from the cli.

This has been addressed first here[1], then there[2] which had to be
reverted there[3].  So here again a fix.

Closes-bug: #1508511

[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238156/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/262809/

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-05 19:28:53.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/neutron_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/neutron_router/neutron_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Neutron parses the wrong json revert to shell/csv.

The neutron network provider is parsing the wrong json format leading
to an error when you're unlucky. Affected providers:
 - neutron_port
 - neutron_subnet
 - neutron_router
 - neutron_network

The neutron provider parses the json of the cliff-tablib's output while
the official one is the cliff' output[1].

As discussed in the ML[2] this patch implements a simple revert of the
json change.

Revert "Use json output instead plain-text"

This reverts commit 79f0e636c07b80b2c6699d934b42641bfef4352b[3]
 and part of commit 791a0f146b28544ec3d70c0ab2a950c4d5ca9f98[4]

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-neutronclient/+bug/1529914
[2]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/083172.html
[3]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238156/
[4]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/261418/

Change-Id: I93263256eb9d83544910ca4055bb3e9a463645e3
Closes-bug: 1530163
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron parses the wrong json revert to shell/csv.

The neutron network provider is parsing the wrong json format leading
to an error when you're unlucky. Affected providers:
 - neutron_port
 - neutron_subnet
 - neutron_router
 - neutron_network

The neutron provider parses the json of the cliff-tablib's output while
the official one is the cliff' output[1].

As discussed in the ML[2] this patch implements a simple revert of the
json change.

Revert "Use json output instead plain-text"

This reverts commit 79f0e636c07b80b2c6699d934b42641bfef4352b[3]
 and part of commit 791a0f146b28544ec3d70c0ab2a950c4d5ca9f98[4]

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-neutronclient/+bug/1529914
[2]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/083172.html
[3]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238156/
[4]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/261418/

Change-Id: I93263256eb9d83544910ca4055bb3e9a463645e3
Closes-bug: 1530163

commit_message:
Fix database purge query

Fix raw_template purge query on MySQL, and handle stack tags before
removing stacks. This also removes a bunch of race conditions where we
deleted incorrect data.

Change-Id: I7b7a1d94acefbaeeed86f1833c979819361c8988
Closes-Bug: #1524387

subject: Add separate non-voting job to check doc links for JJB
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-11 13:33:13.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add separate non-voting job to check doc links for JJB

Add's a non-voting job to catch both invalid links being added, and
valid links going stale over time in the JJB documentation built using
sphinx.

Needs to be non-voting to avoid requiring the external resources are
always reachable for patches to pass. In the future sphinx should
contain a change[1] to ensure that warnings in the linkcheck builder
will become errors when the warniserror option is enabled, which will
make such problems with external resources fatal.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/1815

Change-Id: I7526b737523249b07defc03f19998c8f615bdddb
Depends-On: I80446abe96824a444a04cc526df6cc38632a4607
"}]
commit_message:
Add separate non-voting job to check doc links for JJB

Add's a non-voting job to catch both invalid links being added, and
valid links going stale over time in the JJB documentation built using
sphinx.

Needs to be non-voting to avoid requiring the external resources are
always reachable for patches to pass. In the future sphinx should
contain a change[1] to ensure that warnings in the linkcheck builder
will become errors when the warniserror option is enabled, which will
make such problems with external resources fatal.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/1815

Change-Id: I7526b737523249b07defc03f19998c8f615bdddb
Depends-On: I80446abe96824a444a04cc526df6cc38632a4607

subject: Enhance description of instance-uuid option for image-create
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-18 09:41:30.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/tests/unit/v2/fixtures.py', 'glanceclient/v2/image_schema.py'], 'message': 'Enhance description of instance-uuid option for image-create

Current description of instance-uuid may confuse users because
they may think that instance-uuid can serve as basis for image
but it just stores instance-uuid as image-metadata.
So we need to enhance the description in glanceclient.

Change-Id: I55829d106c9d25374df6538b3071104ee5f215f2
Closes-Bug: #1496822
'}]
commit_message:
Enhance description of instance-uuid option for image-create

Current description of instance-uuid may confuse users because
they may think that instance-uuid can serve as basis for image
but it just stores instance-uuid as image-metadata.
So we need to enhance the description in glanceclient.

Change-Id: I55829d106c9d25374df6538b3071104ee5f215f2
Closes-Bug: #1496822

commit_message:
Set DIB_NO_TMPFS=1

The undercloud has 5G of RAM, we need to assert that .5 of this
isn't allocated to a tmpfs for image building. We just don't have
enough for that.

Change-Id: I66b8fd93925dd2abc91ca8faa4c0d4482022ed44

commit_message:
Clean up removed hacking rule from [flake8] ignore lists

We bump hacking>=0.10.0, and hacking removed some rules, for
the full list of rules please see [1]. So don't need them any more.

Hacking related commits:
Remove H904 in commit b1fe19ebebe47a36b905d709467f5e82521bbd96
Remove H803 in commit f01ce4fd822546cbd52a0aedc49184bddbfe1b10

commit_message:
Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess.

os.popen() is deprecated since version 2.6. Resolved with use of subprocess module.

Change-Id: I2172d4ca8b2a5fc66344dc9bd429a2ef7f94c993
Closes-Bug: #1529836

commit_message:
Fix hosts configuration in df_db.py

Commit a5a2f1433888ac8eb64eecbd521c2c8e95de68f4 introduces DB cluster
configuration, but it doesn't apply it to df_db.py script which causes
it is unable to work with this parameter.

Change-Id: Ic7b50b255c18bba5f7d31d03ab726a95925e4d89

commit_message:
Replace upload_core_repos with Puppet-only task

Currently the code responsible for configuring repositories on the
managed nodes is kept directly it Nailgun. This commit introduces a new
task setup_repositories that replaces upload_core_repos.

Closes-Bug: 1508486
Change-Id: I1b83e3bfaebecdb8455d5697e320f24fb4941536

commit_message:
Glance metadata definition i18n support needed

The Glance Metadata Definitions (metadefs) need to be able to display
the display-name, titles and descriptions for Namespaces, Objects and
Properties in alternate languages.

Change-Id: Id2d3689a096df2b5574cd0f8642aa4dbf0433813
Implements: blueprint metadefs-i18n-support
Depends-On: I473e3ee718e0f59714f88cb17637243dca5a2fba

commit_message:
Glance metadata definition i18n support needed

The Glance Metadata Definitions (metadefs) need to be able to display
the display-name, titles and descriptions for Namespaces, Objects and
Properties in alternate languages.

Change-Id: I08d0514cd04791889dd56c562084f8318e57935c
Implements: blueprint metadefs-i18n-support

commit_message:
Cache prefetcher to talk to trusteduath registry

Glance cache prefetcher needs admin context when attempting to talk
to registry for fetching image metadata. However, when registry
is deployed in trusted-auth mode, appropriate admin role needs to be
set in context to gain admin context on registry.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ida3f0d586602ca86bd5bd05ddab1e424fa8ddd4a
Closes-bug: #1502991

commit_message:
Deploy multirack environment with shared networks

Refactor tests for multiple cluster networks feature so
all tests use fuel-devops environment which has 3 nodegroups,
shared L2 network and it's defined using template. Also allow
tests to configure networks for more than 1 custom nodegroup.
Add additional check for shared storage network (Ceph health).
Create new test case for adding new nodegroup to operational
environment.

Co-Authored-By: Artem Panchenko <apanchenko@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1521316
Implements blueprint test-nodegroup-add
Implements blueprint test-nodegroups-share-networks
Change-Id: I066248a7b96a6f16b1e24763892234fe48803983
(cherry picked from commit 41405c6415bff8dffe7e05783c6bf666bf482da5)

commit_message:
Deploy multirack environment with shared networks

Refactor tests for multiple cluster networks feature so
all tests use fuel-devops environment which has 3 nodegroups,
shared L2 network and it's defined using template. Also allow
tests to configure networks for more than 1 custom nodegroup.
Add aditional check for shared storage network (Ceph health).
Create new test case for adding new nodegroup to operational
environment.

Co-Authored-By: Artem Panchenko <apanchenko@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1521316
Implements blueprint test-nodegroup-add
Implements blueprint test-nodegroups-share-networks

commit_message:
manage stderr output from external commands

Only show error output from external commands in debug mode. This
suppresses "fatal" messages that are fatal to git, but not reno, for
example.

Change-Id: Ic9a9fcf30fd2f9ff2c0a837de45dd062b7a900e8
Related-Bug: 1534613

revisions:

helpers, webpack and karma configs) and also splits .eslintrc

support ES6 syntax, so nailgun/.eslintrc now contains common

Change-Id: I1956f2022475b39724dfb49f98bdc8e6e5d898e9

commit_message:
Enable linting for node.js files and split .eslintrc

This commit enables linting for node.js files (gulpfile and
helpers, webpack and karma configs) and also splits .eslintrc
into 2 files. This is needed because our node.js files don't
support ES6 syntax, so nailgun/.eslintrc now contains common
linting rules and nailgun/static/.eslintrc contains JSX
and ES6-specific rules.

Implements: blueprint converge-to-eslint-config-openstack

Change-Id: I1956f2022475b39724dfb49f98bdc8e6e5d898e9

commit_message:
Allow comparision (= and !=) for values of different types

Instead of many custom implementations of = and !=
operators (*equal and *not_equal) now there is one
common implementation that was previously used
for legacy mode. Thus legacy behavior was restored.

Change-Id: Ia80bcde213a90c09ad07b259f82883ebd46b06bc
Closes-Bug: #1535068

commit_message:
Incorrect engine option was used for CLI

CLI used an engine setting with wrong name. As a result
sets that were produced by queries were not converted to
lists and could not serialize to JSON. Because CLI uses
JSON serialization to display output an error message
was shown instead.

Change-Id: I4cf2714ca61f89d85ea3c7868f13e8d60df4eef2
Closes-Bug: #1534947

commit_message:
Add diff functionality to cli

Added 'DictDiffer' class which is responsible for
generating and showing differences between dictionaries,
using dictdiffer library.
It enables to see changes made to locally edited yaml
configuration files - before uploading them

New option '--diff' added to all fuelclient features
which implement 'download' and 'upload'.
Also moved utils.py to common/.

The following patch includes only 'fuel1' changes,
Changes for fuel2 will be provided in separate patch,
because there's a lot to review already.

Change-Id: Ibbbbc135ffe67860ee44433baf33fff81b48fd1c
DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #1404373
Implements: blueprint fuelclient-config-diff

commit_message:
Cleanup of Translations

In preparation for mitaka, do a cleanup of translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

Stats for removed files:
ceilometer-log-error.pot: Total strings 34
ceilometer/locale/en_GB/LC_MESSAGES/ceilometer-log-error.po: Translated: 7

commit_message:
Ensure that ansible_processor_vcpus always has a default value

In some cases Ansible does not detect the number of CPU's on the
target host. This patch ensures that in such cases there is always
a usable value.

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I2c7db9f6a97b131700c3aad5d49b6a206141f34b
Closes-Bug: #1530742

commit_message:
[Ceilometer] Fixes for Ceilometer tests

- Lists of pollsters and notifications were actualized
according to pipeline changes
- Polling interval in MOS 8.0 was increased to 10 minutes,
so steps with nova pollsters were removed
- A lot of Glance notifications were deprecated in MOS 8.0,
so method was rewrited using Glance events
- In MOS 8.0 feature with mandatory limits was added,
so method for samples was rewrited using statistic requests
- Statistics requests only for the last hour were added
in all OSTF where these queries used

Closes-Bug: #1515172
Closes-Bug: #1520664

Change-Id: I66254f362b0daa44b9e03dc57c6ec6c1af46750e
